intro: Cacalia erythrophila, commonly known as the red-flowered cacalia, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, with slender stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its most striking feature is its bright red flowers, which bloom in late summer and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Cacalia erythrophila prefers well-drained soil and full sun, making it a suitable addition to rock gardens and dry landscapes.
